âœ¨ goshs | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Serving files over HTTP/S with enhanced features like authentication, WebDAV support, and ACLs, acting as a replacement for Python's SimpleHTTPServer.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Download and upload files via HTTP/S â€¢ Basic and certificate-based authentication â€¢ WebDAV support â€¢ Read-Only and Upload-Only modes â€¢ File-based ACLs
ðŸ“– Summary: Goshs is a Go-based HTTP server designed as a more feature-rich alternative to Python's SimpleHTTPServer. It supports secure file sharing with HTTPS, authentication, WebDAV, and fine-grained access control through ACLs. It offers various modes of operation, including read-only and upload-only, and can be customized with themes and command-line options.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ neo146 | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Emergency network connection via SMS for accessing information during internet outages or censorship.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ HTTP-SMS gateway â€¢ HTTP-Markdown gateway â€¢ URL to Markdown conversion â€¢ Twitter user timeline retrieval â€¢ Web search using DuckDuckGo
ðŸ“– Summary: neo146 is a minimal information gateway providing emergency network access via SMS. It offers functionalities like converting web pages to Markdown, retrieving Twitter feeds, searching the web, accessing Wikipedia summaries, and providing weather forecasts, all accessible through SMS commands and HTTP endpoints. The project aims to provide a low-bandwidth communication channel inspired by dial-up services.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ googlemaps-scraper | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Extracting and monitoring Google Maps reviews for specific points of interest.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Scrapes Google Maps reviews from specified URLs. â€¢ Allows retrieval of a specified number of reviews. â€¢ Offers incremental scraping and storage of reviews in MongoDB. â€¢ Provides options to scrape POI metadata and sort reviews by relevance, date, or rating.
ðŸ“– Summary: The googlemaps-scraper repository provides tools to scrape reviews from Google Maps places. It allows users to extract a defined number of the most recent reviews or incrementally monitor reviews by storing them in MongoDB. The scraper supports sorting reviews and scraping POI metadata.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ DataSurgeon | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Incident response, DLP, penetration testing, and CTF challenges by extracting sensitive information from text and files.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Supports Windows, Linux, and MacOS â€¢ Recursive file analysis within directories â€¢ Plugin Support â€¢ CSV Output
ðŸ“– Summary: DataSurgeon is a versatile tool written in Rust designed for extracting sensitive information like emails, IPs, credit card numbers, and more from various file types and text. It supports multiple operating systems, offers plugin support for extending functionality, and can output data in CSV format. The tool is primarily used for incident response, data loss prevention, penetration testing, and CTF challenges.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ ClatScope | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: OSINT (Open-Source Intelligence) data gathering and analysis for investigators and pentesters.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ IP Information (Geolocation, ISP) â€¢ Deep Account & Username Search â€¢ Phone Number Parsing â€¢ DNS & Reverse DNS Lookup â€¢ Email Lookup & Header Analysis
ðŸ“– Summary: ClatScope Info Tool is a Python-based OSINT utility designed for gathering and analyzing information from various online resources. It provides a range of features, including IP geolocation, DNS lookups, email analysis, phone number parsing, and data breach checks, making it suitable for investigators and pentesters needing reconnaissance capabilities.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ Z | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Debugging Linux applications that employ anti-debugging techniques.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Bypasses anti-debugging mechanisms â€¢ Provides explicit control over program execution â€¢ Supports custom LD_PRELOAD libraries with marker function â€¢ Offers general and execution control commands â€¢ Includes breakpoint management (software and hardware)
ðŸ“– Summary: Z Anti-Anti-Debugger is a Linux debugger designed to bypass anti-debugging mechanisms. It provides precise control over program execution and supports custom LD_PRELOAD libraries. The debugger offers a range of commands for execution control, breakpoint management, and general debugging tasks.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ GeoPincer | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Finding locations based on proximity to a set of known establishments or points of interest using OpenStreetMap data.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Leverages OpenStreetMap's Overpass API â€¢ Searches for locations based on a set of nodes (establishments) â€¢ Allows specifying a base area to search within â€¢ Uses a default range of 500 meters between nodes, adjustable with the `--distance` argument
ðŸ“– Summary: GeoPincer is a Python script that utilizes the OpenStreetMap Overpass API to identify locations based on their proximity to a given set of nodes, such as establishments or notable places. It allows users to specify a search area and a distance range to refine the search, returning the results as Google Maps URLs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ PromptWizard | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Task-aware agent-driven prompt optimization for Large Language Models (LLMs).
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Feedback-driven refinement of prompts and examples by LLMs â€¢ Generation of diverse and robust synthetic examples â€¢ Self-generated Chain of Thought (CoT) steps with positive, negative, and synthetic examples
ðŸ“– Summary: PromptWizard is a framework for optimizing prompts using a self-evolving mechanism where the LLM generates, critiques, and refines its own prompts and examples. It leverages feedback-driven refinement, diverse example generation, and self-generated Chain of Thought to improve task performance. The framework supports optimizing prompts with and without examples or training data.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
